message_1: What are the products formed when a piece of iron is placed in a solution containing copper ions? Write the balanced chemical equation for the single replacement reaction that occurs.
message_2:
When a piece of iron is placed in a solution containing copper ions, a single replacement reaction occurs. In this reaction, iron displaces copper ions, forming iron ions and solid copper. The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

Fe (s) + Cu²⁺ (aq) → Fe²⁺ (aq) + Cu (s)
